      • getObject

        public static java.lang.Object getObject​(java.lang.String prompt,
                                         java.lang.Object[] options,
                                         java.lang.Object initialObject)
        Let the user choose between the specified options and return one of them
        Parameters:
        prompt - the message string to be displayed inside dialog
        options - the available options the user choose from
        initialObject - a hint for the user which option is default
        Returns:
        The option, the user has chosen. Null if user canceled input.

      • getGenericObject

        public static <T> T getGenericObject​(java.lang.Class<T> tClass,
                                     java.lang.String prompt,
                                     T[] options,
                                     T initialOption)
        Let the user choose between the specified options and return one of them. if options are null, tClass must be primitive, so that the input can be parsed
        Type Parameters:
        T - The Type of class returned
        Parameters:
        tClass - The class to return
        prompt - the message string to be displayed inside dialog
        options - the available options the user choose from (can be null)
        initialOption - a hint for the user which option is default (can be null)
        Returns:
        The option, the user has chosen. Null if user canceled input

      • output

        public static void output​(java.lang.String content)
        Prints the String passed as content in a window.
        Parameters:
        content - the displayed String

      • output

        public static void output​(java.lang.String content,
                          java.lang.String prompt)
        Prints the String passed as content in a window with the title passed as prompt.
        Parameters:
        content - the displayed String
        prompt - the title String
